com.storageroomapp.client.field

Class GenericField<T extends GenericValue<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.storageroomapp.client.field.GenericField<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanField, DateField, FileField, FloatField, ImageField, IntegerField, LocationField, StringField, TimeField

extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

    • Method Detail

      • cloneAsMetadataField

        protected GenericField<T> cloneAsMetadataField(Collection otherCollection)
        Copies a metadata field from one collection to another. This is used when copying over the standard fields that occur in all collections into a newly created collection.

      • cloneAsMetadataField

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        Gets the StorageRoom type label for this field. Examples include StringField, TimeField, IntegerField, etc.
        Returns:
        the String type

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of this field, provided by the admin user when creating the field in the SR UI.
        Returns:
        the String name

      • getIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getIdentifier()
        The internal identifier used for this field in API calls. Generally, it is the lowercase version of the name, with spaces replaced with underscores.
        Returns:
        the String id

      • isCompoundFieldType

        public boolean isCompoundFieldType()
        Returns whether this field represents a compound type. This is useful for StorageRoom UI apps to know when to show a complicated value editor. Compound types are File, Image, Location and others.
        Returns:
        true if it is a compound type, false if not.

      • getValueWrapper

        public T getValueWrapper()
        Returns the wrapper object that carrys the value of this field. This will never return null, even if the underlying value is not set.

        This bears some more explanation.

        Because this Java client is largely a json serialization/deserialization tool (at least when we are down to the Field level), there is a lot of machinery that is responsible for converting objects into StorageRoom json and back. The value wrapper returned by this method is critical to that capability.

        If this Field object is a metadata field (i.e. associated with a Collection not an Entry), then calling this method will result in an exception being thrown. This radical approach is meant to root out serious coding bugs that can result by mistaking Collection as Entry fields.

        Returns:
        the wrapper GenericField subclass appropriate for the field type

      • getValueAsString

        public java.lang.String getValueAsString()
        A convenience method to quickly get the value of this field as a String.
        Returns:
        the String value

      • setValue

        public void setValue(T newValue)
        When planning to update an Entry, this method allows you to set the Field value to a new value.

        Note, if you wish to nullify a field value, do not pass null to this method. Instead, instantiate the proper GenericValue subclass (e.g. StringValue) using the default constructor, which sets the inner value to null. Then, pass that constructed GenericValue into this method.

        Parameters:
        newValue - the new value for the field. It should never be null.

      • isSameField

        public boolean isSameField(GenericField<?> match)
        Determines if two fields refer to the same Field in the same Collection. It does NOT check for value equality, entry equality, or anything else.
        Parameters:
        match - the field to match
        Returns:
        true if they are the same field in the collection

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
